subject: RE: [junit] Looking for some "Best Practices"
msgSnippet: Yes this is possible through the batch test piece of the junit task in ant.  You just embed a nested fileset which contains a pattern to match your tests. Josh

Yes this is possible through the batch test piece of the junit task in ant.  You just embed a nested fileset which contains a pattern to match your tests.  
 
Josh

-----Original Message-----
From: Vikas Malla [mailto:malla6um@...]
Sent: Thursday, November 21, 2002 7:14 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Looking for some "Best Practices"



Is ther a java utility that collects all the test names in various folders/subfolders, inserts them in the right place in the ant build.xml ? This also removes the dependence on the platform.
Thanks.
Robert Wenner <robert@...> wrote:On Wednesday 20 November 2002 20:31, Vikas Malla wrote:
> Is there a tool that goes thru my test folders and lists all the
> classes and creates a list of files so that it can be incorporated in
> my <junit> task when running the tests through ant.? Thanks,

Yes, find and grep.

Robert
